page.title: 04HEDGEROWS, BURSTON AREA
page.content:
As a result of the type of farming in the area, fields are generally small and hedgerows have been maintained along the field boundaries.The small fields give the farmer flexibility in moving his cattle.The hedges and trees in them give protection from the wind. The hedges also protect and provide a route for the ditches which help to drain the heavy soil.
Most hedgerows contain a large number of species of mature and young trees, shrubs and wild flowers and are a sig- nificant feature in the landscape.All the elm trees have died from Dutch Elm Disease and have been replaced by the landlords with the help of the County Council's Tree replacement Scheme.
